items.name: Chest
items.description: Stores up to 27 stacks of items or blocks.

items.name: Crafting Table
items.description: When placed on the ground, it provides use of the 3Ã—3 crafting grid.

items.name: Furnace
items.description: Provides the ability to smelt blocks and items.

items.name: Stick
items.description: Used for crafting many tools and items.

items.name: Torch
items.description: Emits light. It also has the ability to melt ice and snow.

items.name: Wood Planks
items.description: Common blocks used in many crafting recipes. The texture resembles a network of planks, coming in six different shades obtained from the six different tree varieties.

items.name: Anvil
items.description: Used to combine enchantments, repair or rename items or blocks. Anvils are affected by gravity. On average, an anvil will survive for 25 uses.

items.name: Beacon
items.description: Emits a light beam that can provide temporary player buffs, when placed on a pyramid made of diamond, emerald, gold or iron blocks. Require an unobstructed view of the sky. Can also be used as a landmark.

items.name: Block of Coal
items.description: Can be a compact way to store coal, and can be used for decoration and fuel.

items.name: Block of Quartz
items.description: Mineral block used only for decoration.

items.name: Block of Redstone
items.description: Acts as a piston-movable redstone power source which cannot be turned off.

items.name: Bookshelf
items.description: Used as decoration or to give an Enchantment Table a boost for better enchantments.

items.name: Bricks
items.description: Decorative building material.

items.name: Chiseled Quartz Block
items.description: Used as decorative building material.

items.name: Chiseled Sandstone
items.description: Decorative form of sandstone with a Creeper face and various small carvings on it.

items.name: Clay (block)
items.description: Can be used as building material or to store clay. It is commonly found below water

items.name: Glowstone
items.description: Glowstones emits more light than a normal torch. It will melt nearby snow and ice. Breaking a glowstone block, will give 2-4 Glowstone Dust back.

items.name: Hay Bale
items.description: Used as decorative block, or as food for horses. It is flammable.

items.name: Jack o'Lantern
items.description: Acts as a torch, but emits more light. Can stay lit underwater and melts nearby snow.

items.name: Nether Brick
items.description: Block found only in the The Nether Fortresses. It is immune to Ghast fireballs.

items.name: Pillar Quartz Block
items.description: Used as decorative building material.

items.name: Sandstone
items.description: Used as a building material and commonly found in deserts. Sandstone is not influenced by gravity like normal Sand.

items.name: Smooth Sandstone
items.description: Decorative form of sandstone with a smoother texture.

items.name: Snow
items.description: Used as building material, decoration and storing snowballs. Snow blocks are harder to be destroyed than normal snow and are impervious to torches and water.

items.name: Snow (layer)
items.description: Used as building material, decoration and storing snowballs. Snow blocks are harder to be destroyed than normal snow and are impervious to torches and water.

items.name: Colored Terracotta
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Stone Bricks
items.description: Used as building material. Found in strongholds and in the basements of igloos

items.name: Slab
items.ingredients: 3 Wood Planks OR 3 Stone OR 3 Sandstone OR 3 Cobblestone OR 3 Bricks OR 3 Stone Bricks OR 3 Nether Brick OR 3 Block of Quartz OR 6 Purpur Block
items.description: Half-version of its respective block. Two slabs placed on top of each other, will create a normal sized double slab block.

items.name: Stairs
items.ingredients: 6 Wood Planks OR 6 Stone OR 6 Sandstone OR 6 Cobblestone OR 6 Bricks OR 6 Stone Bricks OR 6 Nether Brick OR 6 Block of Quartz OR 6 Purpur Block
items.description: Allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping

items.name: TNT
items.description: An explosive block. When activated, it creates an explosion that damages nearby creatures and destroys nearby blocks

items.name: Axe
items.ingredients: 2 Stick + 3 Wood Planks OR 3 Cobblestone OR 3 Iron Ingot OR 3 Gold Ingot OR 3 Diamond
items.description: Tool used to ease the process of collecting wood based items.

items.name: Bucket
items.description: Used to carry water, lava or milk. Water and lava can be gathered from water or lava blocks, that are not running. Milk can be obtained by clicking on a cow with the bucket.

items.name: Carrot on a Stick
items.description: Used while riding pigs to control them. The direction the carrot dangles is the direction the pig will go. The pig will run faster if the player right clicks while holding the stick.

items.name: Clock
items.description: Clocks are items that display the current in-game time. It is done by displaying the sun and the moon's position, relative to the horizon.

items.name: Compass
items.description: The compass will always point to your original spawn point. Can't be used in The Nether or in The End.

items.name: Fishing Rod
items.description: Used to catch fish. You can also use them to grab movable objects and drag them towards yourself.

items.name: Flint and Steel
items.description: Used to create fire. Can set blocks or creatures on fire.

items.name: Hoe
items.ingredients: 2 Sticks + 2 Wood Planks OR 2 Cobblestone OR 2 Iron Ingot OR 2 Gold Ingot OR 2 Diamonds
items.description: Used to till dirt and grass into farmland for crops. There is a chance that seeds will drop, when you till grass blocks.

items.name: Map
items.description: The Map is used to view explored terrain. While a map is being held in the player's hand, it will gradually be drawn as the player explores the world.

items.name: Pickaxe
items.ingredients: 2 Stick + 3 Wood Planks OR 3 Cobblestone OR 3 Iron Ingot OR 3 Gold Ingot OR 3 Diamond
items.description: Used to mine ore and blocks. Only Iron and Diamond Pickaxes can mine all ores and blocks; Diamond can mine obsidian.

items.name: Shears
items.description: Tools used to obtain wool from sheeps, leaves from trees, Red Mushrooms from Mushrooms or to get string from cobwebs.

items.name: Shovel
items.ingredients: 2 Stick + 1 Wood Planks OR 1 Cobblestone OR 1 Iron Ingot OR 1 Gold Ingot OR 1 Diamond
items.description: Used to effectively dig sand, dirt, gravel, snow and clay. Required to dig snowballs.

items.name: Arrow
items.description: Can be used as ammunition for a bow or dispenser. It can be modified to imbue status effects on players and mobs.

items.name: Bow
items.description: Ranged weapon used to fire arrows. To use it you must have arrows in your inventory.

items.name: Sword
items.ingredients: 1 Stick + 2 Wood Planks OR 2 Cobblestone OR 2 Iron Ingot OR 2 Gold Ingot OR 2 Diamond
items.description: Melee weapon mainly used to deal damage to mobs and/or players.

items.name: Boots
items.ingredients: 4 Leather OR 4 Gold Ingot OR 4 Iron Ingot OR 4 Diamond
items.description: Foot armor that adds extra protection. Chain boots can only be dropped from a mob

items.name: Chestplate
items.ingredients: 8 Leather OR 8 Gold Ingot OR 8 Iron Ingot OR 8 Diamond
items.description: Chest armor that adds extra protection. Chain chestplate can only be dropped from a mob

items.name: Helmet
items.ingredients: 5 Leather OR 5 Gold Ingot OR 5 Iron Ingot OR 5 Diamond
items.description: Head armor that adds extra protection. Chain helmet can only be dropped from a mob

items.name: Leggins
items.ingredients: 7 Leather OR 7 Gold Ingot OR 7 Iron Ingot OR 7 Diamond
items.description: Leg armor that adds extra protection. Chain leggings can only be dropped from a mob

items.name: Activator Rail
items.description: Used to activate TNT Minecarts or Minecarts with Hoppers.

items.name: Boat
items.description: Vehicle that enables you to travel in water, faster than swimming.

items.name: Detector Rail
items.ingredients: 1 Stone Pressure Plate + 6 Iron Ingot + 1 Redstone
items.description: Functions like a Pressure Plate, it sends a Redstone signal when powered. Can only be activated by a minecart.

items.name: Minecart
items.description: Vehicle entity used for transporting players or mobs along minetracks.

items.name: Minecart with Chest
items.description: Used to transport goods and items along minetracks.

items.name: Minecart with Hopper
items.description: Minecart that moves items in and out of inventories in the same way as a normal hopper.

items.name: Minecart with TNT
items.description: Explodes when triggered by a activator rail or when it is hit.

items.name: Minecart with Furnace
items.description: Can be used to push other minecarts. You need fuel to power this minecart.

items.name: Powered Rail
items.description: Non solid block that is used to stop or increase momentum of moving minecarts. Powered Rails are powered by Redstone currents.

items.name: Rail
items.description: Minecart tracks where minecart vehicles can travel along.

items.name: Daylight Sensor
items.description: Block that outputs a redstone signal based on sunlight (or lack thereof).

items.name: Dispenser
items.description: Dispensers can store 9 stacks of items or blocks in a 3x3 grid. When powered by a Redstone charge, it ejects the items in random order. Some items are fired out as projectiles.

items.name: Wooden Door
items.description: Wooden Doors can be activated by right-clicking on them or by a redstone signal.

items.name: Iron Door
items.description: Iron Doors on the other hand, can only be activated by a redstone signal.

items.name: Dropper
items.description: The dropper is a block that can be used to eject items, or push items into another container.

items.name: Hopper
items.description: Block that can be used to catch item entities, or to transfer items into and out of containers.

items.name: Jukebox
items.description: Used to play music discs. Right-click the jukebox with a music disc selected to play it.

items.name: Lever
items.description: Sends an electrical signal when switched to the 'on' position. Stays in its current state, unless it is clicked again.

items.name: Note Block
items.description: Plays a note when used or powered by redstone. Right click it to change the pitch of the note. A different instrument is played depending on the type of block it is placed on.

items.name: Piston
items.ingredients: 3 Wood Planks + 4 Cobblestone + 1 Iron Ingot + 1 Redstone
items.description: Pushes blocks or entities 1 space forward. Can also move players and mobs. Activated by redstone circuits.

items.name: Pressure Plate
items.description: Triggers a redstone signal, when a player or mob walks on it. Wood Pressure Plates are also activated when something is dropped on them.

items.name: Redstone Comparator
items.description: Block used in redstone circuits to maintain, compare, or subtract signal strength, or to measure certain block states (primarily the fullness of containers).

items.name: Redstone Lamp
items.description: Emits a light when powered by redstone.

items.name: Redstone Repeater
items.description: Block used in redstone circuits to 'repeat' redstone signals back to full strength, delay signals, prevent signals moving backwards, or to 'lock' signals in one state. The switch can be toggled by clicking it and has 4 settings from 0.1 to 0.4 seconds delay.

items.name: Redstone Torch
items.description: Sends a constant redstone signal. Can also be used as a receiver/transmitter when connected to the side of a block. Emits a small amount of light.

items.name: Sticky Piston
items.description: Pushes and pulls blocks and objects 1 space. Pulls the block it is touching when retracted. Activated or controlled by redstone circuits.

items.name: Button
items.description: Sends a redstone signal when pressed. The signal lasts for approximately one second.

items.name: Wooden Trapdoor
items.description: Functions as a horizontal door but are only 1x1 block in size. Can be activated by right-clicking it or with redstone.

items.name: Iron Trapdoor
items.description: Functions as a horizontal door but are only 1x1 block in size. Iron trapdoors can only be opened with redstone power.

items.name: Trapped Chest
items.description: Chest that sends out a signal when opened. Can be used to create traps.

items.name: Tripwire Hook
items.description: Used to create a tripwire that activates a redstone signal. You can hang a string across a pair of hooks, and the tripwire will be activated when someone runs across it.

items.name: Weighted Pressure Plate
items.description: Similar to a normal pressure plate, but can only be activated by items. The number of items determines the strength of the signal. Comes in two versions, a light (gold) and a heave (iron).

items.name: Bowl
items.description: Containers which are used to hold certain meals.

items.name: Bread
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 2.5 hunger points.

items.name: Cake
items.description: Restores 1 hunger point per use for a total of 6 uses. Returns empty buckets when crafted. Must be placed to eat.

items.name: Cookie
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 1 hunger point.

items.name: Enchanted Golden Apple
items.description: Provides Absorption IV for 2 minutes (providing 16 (gold hearts) points of absorption health), Regeneration II (1 half heart every 25 ticks) for 20 seconds (long enough to heal 16 points of damage), Fire Resistance I for 5 minutes and Resistance I (20% reduced damage from all sources except the Void) for 5 minutes.

items.name: Golden Apple
items.description: provides Absorption I for 2 minutes (providing 4 (gold hearts) points of absorption health) and Regeneration II (1 half heart every 25 ticks) for 5 seconds (long enough to heal 4 points of damage).

items.name: Golden Carrot
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 4 hunger points. Golden Carrot is also used in some brewing recipes.

items.name: Melon Seeds
items.description: Plantable on farmland. Will produce one Melon each harvest.

items.name: Mushroom Stew
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 3 hunger points. The bowl can be reused.

items.name: Pumpkin Pie
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 4 hunger points. Recipe fits within the 2x2 crafting grid of the players inventory.

items.name: Pumpkin Seeds
items.description: Plantable on farmland. Will produce one Pumpkin each harvest.

items.name: Sugar
items.description: Food ingredient derived from sugar canes.

items.name: Bed
items.description: Used to change time from night to day. In SMP, all players in the Overworld must be in beds. Also changes the spawn point of the player, but compasses remains unaffected until you die and respawn.

items.name: Book
items.description: Used to create book and quills, bookshelfs or an enchantment table. Can be enchanted.

items.name: Book and Quill
items.description: Books that players can write in, read and edit.

items.name: Carpet
items.description: Carpets are thin like pressure plates and can be used as floor decoration. The color of the wool determines the carpet color.

items.name: Cobblestone Wall
items.description: Decorative block that acts in a similar way to fences.

items.name: Ender Chest
items.description: A placeable block used to store items. They function like normals chests, but their items can be accessed by any other ender chest in the world. If the ender chest is destroyed, none of its contents will be dropped and new ender chests can be created to access them.

items.name: Eye of Ender
items.description: Used to locate Strongholds, repair an End Portal block and craft Ender Chests. When thrown, they float towards the direction of a portal, which appear in strongholds. After a few seconds, it will drop with a chance of breaking.

items.name: Fence
items.description: Used as a barrier that players and mobs cannot jump over, with the exception of spiders and spider jockeys. It is 1.5 blocks high for mobs and players, but only 1 to other blocks.

items.name: Fence Gate
items.description: Fence gates serves as a door for a row of fences. They can be opened both inward and outwards. They are opened by right-clicking or with a redstone signal.

items.name: Fire Charge
items.ingredients: 1 Blaze Powder + 1 Coal OR 1 Charcoal + 1 Gunpowder
items.description: Fire Charges can be used as a instead of flint and steel. Left click on an open area and a fire will start. Can also be used as ammunition for dispensers, where they will shot out as a fireball.

items.name: Firework Rocket
items.ingredients: 1 OR 2 OR 3 Gunpowder + Paper + Firework Star
items.description: Firework that can be launched into the sky and explore. Adding more gunpowder increases the duration of the rocket. Up to three gunpowder can be used. Multiple firework stars can also be used, in which case all will go off simultaneously when the rocket detonates. By limiting the amount of gunpowder to one, it is possible to use up to seven firework stars.

items.name: Firework Star
items.description: Used to create firework rockets. The dye determines the colour of the firework, and the extra ingredient determines a special effect. Extra ingredient can for example be diamonds, gold nuggets or a mob head.

items.name: Flower Pot
items.description: Used as decoratives. Allows flowers, mushrooms, saplings, cactus, ferns and dead bushes to be placed in it.

items.name: Glass Panes
items.description: Glass Panes is a block that, can be shaped in similar way to fences. Their placement behavior is similar to Redstone, Iron Bars, and Fences. They have the same texture as Glass. They cannot currently be placed horizontally.

items.name: Gold Ingot
items.description: Gold is used in several crafting recipes, e.g. tools and armors.

items.name: Iron Bars
items.description: Similar to fences. They are only counted as 1 block high, instead of 1.5 blocks.

items.name: Item Frame
items.description: Used as decoration. Blocks or items can be placed inside the frame by right clicking the frame with the item selected.

items.name: Ladder
items.description: Used for climbing walls. You can climb either horizontally or vertically. To climb safely, you can sneak while climbing (hold shift).

items.name: Lead
items.description: Items used to leash and lead passive mobs.

items.name: Melon Block
items.description: Grown when farming by planting melon seed. Can not be eaten, but can be used to store melon slices.

items.name: Mineral Block
items.ingredients: 9 Gold Ingot OR 9 Iron Ingot OR 9  Diamonds OR 9 Lapis Lazuli OR 9 Emeralds
items.description: Turns minerals into a placeable block. Can be used as expensive building block or storage.

items.name: Nether Brick Fence
items.description: Used as a barrier that players and mobs cannot jump over, with the exception of spiders and spider jockeys. It is 1.5 blocks high for mobs and players, but only 1 to other blocks. Nether Brick Fence cannot be set on fire like wood fence.

items.name: Painting
items.description: Images used as decoration. Paintings can only be placed on vertical surfaces. An easy way to get a painting to fill up an area is to mark the bounds with any solid block and place it in the bottom left corner.

items.name: Paper
items.description: Used as crafting material to create maps, compass and books.

items.name: Sign
items.description: Can display a text. Text can be 4 lines, 15 characters per line. To change the text, destroy the sign and place it again. Placed in the ground or on walls.

items.name: Stained Glass
items.description: Stained Glass is the dyed version of regular glass that can be used for decoration purposes.

items.name: Blaze Powder
items.description: Item made from a Blaze Rod obtained from a Blaze.

items.name: Brewing Stand
items.description: Brewing stands are used for brewing all kinds potions.

items.name: Cauldron
items.description: Storage of water for water bottles. They can fill glass bottles to make water bottles. Holds enough water for three water bottles.

items.name: Enchantment Table
items.description: The enchantment table allows users to use experience levels and lapis lazuli to enchant weapons, armor, and tools.

items.name: Fermented Spider Eye
items.description: Used in Potions. All potions with Fermented Spider Eye in have negative effects. This ingredient is mostly used in splash potions.

items.name: Glass Bottle
items.description: Used for brewing potions. To create a water bottle, right click on a water source with an empty bottle.

items.name: Glistering Melon
items.description: Used in brewing to create health restoration potions.

items.name: Gold Nugget
items.description: Used to craft Glistering Melon. Dropped by Zombie Pigman. Can be crafted into Gold Ingots.

items.name: Magma Cream
items.description: Used in Potions, mostly for fire resistance.

items.name: Bone Meal
items.description: Material that can be used as a dye as well as a fertilizer for most plants.

items.name: Cyan Dye
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Dandelion Yellow Dye
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Gray Dye
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Light Blue Dye
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Light Gray Dye
items.ingredients: 1 Ink Sack + 1 Bone Meal OR 1 Gray Dye + 1 Bone Meal
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass. Can be made using an ink sac and two bonemeal or gray dye and bonemeal. Combining gray dye with bonemeal is better because you make 4 light gray dye from every ink sac (instead of 3).

items.name: Lime Dye
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Magenta Dye
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Orange Dye
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Pink Dye
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Purple Dye
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Rose Red
items.description: Used to change the color of wool, leather armor, hardened clay, certain mobs, the banner and glass.

items.name: Colored Wool
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Diorite
items.description: Igneous rock that can be found in caves. Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Polished Diorite
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Andesite
items.description: Igneous rock that can be found in caves. Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Polished Andesite
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Granite
items.description: Igneous rock that can be found in caves. Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Polished Granite
items.description: Used as decoration or building material.

items.name: Coarse Dirt
items.description: Variation of dirt that will not grow grass

items.name: Prismarine
items.description: Stone-like material that only appears underwater in ocean monuments.

items.name: Prismarine Bricks
items.description: Decorative form of prismarine with a sawtooth-edged brick pattern.

items.name: Dark Prismarine
items.description: Decorative form of prismarine; it is dark, with a tight grid pattern.

items.name: Sea Lantern
items.description: Underwater light sources that appear in ocean monuments.

items.name: Slime Block
items.description: Transparent block with unique properties: it can bounce entities and when you land on it you don't take fall damage

items.name: Banner
items.description: Tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes.

items.name: Rabbit Stew
items.ingredients: 1 carrot + 1 Cooked Rabbit + 1 Baked Potato + 1 Mushroom + 1 Bowl
items.description: Food item that can be eaten by the player. Restores 5 hunger points. The bowl can be reused.

items.name: Leather
items.description: Versatile crafting material.

items.name: Armor Stand
items.description: Entity that is able to hold and display wearable items.

items.name: End Rod
items.description: Decorative light sources that emit white particles.

items.name: End Stone Bricks
items.description: End stone-based brick. Used for decoration or as a building block.

items.name: Purpur Block
items.description: Decorative blocks that are naturally generated in end city dungeons in the End.

items.name: Purpur Pillar
items.description: Decorative blocks that are naturally generated in end city dungeons in the End.

items.name: Beetroot Soup
items.description: Eat to restore hunger. Restores 3 hunger points. The bowl can be reused.

items.name: End Crystal
items.description: Item and an entity found in the End. Explodes when hit.

items.name: Shield
items.description: Tool used for protecting the player against attacks.

items.name: Spectral Arrow
items.description: Imbues the Glowing status effect for 10 seconds. The Glowing effect creates an outline of the target, which is visible through blocks, and colored based on the target's team (white by default). If a bow is enchanted with Infinity, spectral arrows will still be consumed.

items.name: Tipped Arrow
items.description: Imbue a potion effect when hitting a mob or player. If a bow is enchanted with Infinity, tipped arrows will still be consumed.

items.name: Magma Block
items.description: Light-emitting naturally occurring blocks found in the Nether that cause fire damage when stepped on.

items.name: Nether Wart Block
items.description: Decorative blocks crafted using nether wart. Cannot store nether wart, due to the fact that it cannot be crafted back into nine nether wart

items.name: Red Nether Brick
items.description: Decorative variant of Nether Brick. It is immune to Ghast fireballs.

items.name: Bone Block
items.description: Decorative block that can face in different directions.

items.name: Colored Shield
items.description: Personalized tool used for protecting the player against attacks. It cannot be repainted or washed in a cauldron.

items.name: Observer
items.description: Block that emits a redstone signal when an adjacent block is updated.

items.name: Shulker Box
items.description: Block that will store and transport items. It keeps the items when broken, which can be retrieved when placed again.

items.name: Colored Shulker Box
items.description: Block that will store and transport items. It keeps the items when broken, which can be retrieved when placed again.

items.name: Concrete Powder
items.description: Block affected by gravity. If a concrete powder block comes into contact with water, it will solidify into a block of concrete.
